page.title: 15SANDWICK - THE BRAIGHE WALL
page.content: I interveiwed{Messers Tawse. They are aiming to repair the damage done by the sea to the wall protecting the road across the Braighe. The contract allows them one year to repair the wall. The council and the E.E.C are paying for it. The cost is{Â£485,000.} 30 people are employed. {The iron girders used are three {quarters of a ton.}The whole wall is to be repaired. They are repairing it properly now becaus it needs it most. they dig for the weak spots and drill about one foot down. They are using concrete and iron rails for repairs. There are about fifteen machines. Tawse own all the machinery. { { {
